27.heading: Upset.

notes: Summary: Gladys doesn't think Brutus should be upset, as Kewpie walks by leaving a trail of dog hair.

28.heading: Upset.
28.title: "How the Heck Can You Tell When He's 'Kinda' Upset?"
28.author: by Aaron McGruder.
notes: Summary: Mr. Freeman is looking for Huey, who has been kind of upset.

30.heading: Upset.
30.title: "Killed by a Friend" 7 p. in Warfront, no. 17
30.author: [No author]
notes: Korean War story: Because of a letter from an old high school pal, Joe mistakenly thinks his girlfriend is two-timing him is so upset he gets himself killed.

31.heading: Upset.
31.title: "The Mayor's Hope!"
31.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Willie Rush tells Joe that Dell Durfee's had six divorces, and she's only in it for the money. Joe gets upset.

32.heading: Upset.
32.title: "Men, Some Unwelcome Visitors Just Arrived. Make Them Leave!"
32.author: Ham Fisher ; M
notes: Summary: The Widow Newton offers Knobby a cottage at the end of the lake, and leads him to it on her bicycle; Mr. Obzo is upset.

33.heading: Upset.
33.title: "My Cat's Going to Smell It, and He's Going to be Extremely Upset"
33.author: by Chip Dunham.
notes: Summary: She has petted Louie, and regrets it, but Louie looks pleased.

34.heading: Upset.
34.title: "Okay, I'm Upset"
34.author: Alex Kotzky, Trusiani.
notes: Summary: Lou didn't need a public relations person anymore, and cancelled the contract without even asking how it would affect Margo. Call no.: PN6726f.B55 "Contracts"

35.heading: Upset.
35.title: "She's Mad because I Didn't Get All Upset about th' King of Geewhiz Proposing to Her!"

36.heading: Upset.

37.heading: Upset.

38.title: "Upset about Getting a Year Older"

41.heading: Upsetting the Peace.

Segar (Popeye), Bill Holman (Smokey Stover), Chester Gould (Dick Tracy), Jack Kent (King Aroo), George Carlson (Jingle Jangle Tales), Basil Wolverton (Powerhouse Pepper), and Carl Barks (Uncle Scrooge). 1. Surrealism in comic books, strips, etc. 2. Herriman, George, 1880-1944. 3. Krazy Kat. 4. Verbeek, Gustave, 1867-1937. 5. The Upside-Downs. 6. Gross, Milt, 1895-1953. 7. Count Screwloose. 8. Segar, E. C. (Elzie Crisler), 1894-1938. 9. Popeye. 10. Holman, Bill, 1903-1987. 11. Smokey Stover. 12. Gould, Chester. 13. Dick Tracy. 15. Kent, Jack, 1920- 16. King Aroo. 17. Carlson, George L. 18. Jingle Jangle Tales. 19. Wolverton, Basil, d. 1978. 20. Powerhouse Pepper. 21. Barks, Carl, 1901- 22. Uncle Scrooge. I. Rosemont, Franklin. II. Cultural Correspondence. Call no.: PN51.C8no.10/11

189.title: Uprisings
notes: See also a series in Adventure Comics in 1938-1939, called The Plantation Uprising. Also the story of the album Indiana Jones et la Cité de la Foudre, involves an attempt to foment an uprising of the Indian people against British colonial rule.
